inscription:
Ebizo_ wa
yakusha wo yame te
shimau to ka
wagami nagara mo
oshiki mono nari

ko_nenn 57 sai
Ichikawa Hakuen

It is regrettable that
Ebizo_(I) will give up
being an actor.
I\'ll be regretful, too
for my own decision.

Ichikawa Hakuen
at the age of 57.
provenance: Kikuchi Keigetsu 菊池契月; Richard P. Gale (until 1974)
text:
The enormously popular actor Ichikawa Danjūrō V (1741–1806) took the name Ebizō in 1791. This painting was made five years after his retirement and carries a poetic inscription by the actor himself, even though it is seemingly written from the viewpoint of another actor. 

Ebizō has given up being an actor; 
being a performer myself,
I regret it happened 
to such a good actor as he.
title: Actor Ichikawa Danjūrō V as Kagekiyo
